title: How to Pay for Apple Music

steps.title: Open iTunes on your PC or Mac.
steps.content: Open iTunes on your PC or Mac. The iTunes icon looks like a purple-and-blue musical note icon in a white circle. You can find it on your Start menu (Windows) or in the Applications folder (Mac). Since your Apple Music subscription is linked to your Apple ID, this method will work for all iPhone, iPad and Android subscriptions.

steps.title: Click the Account tab at the top.
steps.content: Click the Account tab at the top. This will open your account options on a drop-down menu. On Mac , you can find this button on the menu bar at the top of your screen. On Windows , this button is at the top of the iTunes window.

steps.title: Click View My Account on the menu.
steps.content: Click View My Account on the menu. This will prompt you to sign in to your Apple ID.

steps.title: Sign in to your Apple ID.
steps.content: Sign in to your Apple ID. Make sure to enter the correct email address and password you want to use for your Apple Music subscription here, and click Sign in . This will open your Apple ID account information in iTunes.

steps.title: Click the blue Manage Payments link next to "Payment Information.
steps.content: Click the blue Manage Payments link next to "Payment Information. " You can find this option under the "Apple ID Summary" heading.

steps.title: Click the Add Payment button.
steps.content: Click the Add Payment button. This will open the new payment method form.

steps.title: Enter your card information into the new payment form.
steps.content: Enter your card information into the new payment form. Select your card type at the top, and fill out your card number, expiration date, and CVV security code. You can use a VISA, MasterCard, Discover or American Express card here. Alternatively, you can select PayPal at the top, and click Log In to PayPal to link your PayPal account with your Apple ID. This will allow you to use PayPal to pay for iTunes and app purchases, including Apple Music.

steps.title: Enter your billing address.
steps.content: Enter your billing address. You will need to type your full name, and your card's registered billing address in order to validate your new payment method.

steps.title: Click the Done button.
steps.content: Click the Done button. It's located in the lower-right corner of the form. It will validate your new payment method, and add it to your Apple ID account. You can now start an Apple Music subscription with your new payment method. This will take you back to the "Manage Payments" page.

steps.title: Hover over the payment method you want to use (optional).
steps.content: Hover over the payment method you want to use (optional). If you have multiple payment methods saved, you can reorder the list here, and make any of your saved methods your primary. Blue up-and-down arrowhead icons will show up next to the payment method when you hover over it with your mouse. Your purchases and subscriptions, including Apple Music, will be paid with your primary method at the top of the list.

steps.title: Click the blue upward arrow to move the card to the top.
steps.content: Click the blue upward arrow to move the card to the top. Make sure the payment method you want to use for your subscription is at the top of the list here. Apple will automatically charge payment methods in order from top to bottom when you start your Apple Music subscription. [1] X Research source The method at the top of the list will be used to pay for new purchases and subscriptions.

steps.title: Open Settings on your iPhone or iPad.
steps.content: Open Settings on your iPhone or iPad. Find and tap the gray gear icon on your home screen or in an app folder to open the Settings menu. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Tap your name at the top.
steps.content: Tap your name at the top. Your full name and Apple ID picture are listed at the top of your Settings menu. It will open your Apple ID menu. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Manage Payments or Payment & Shipping.
steps.content: Tap Manage Payments or Payment & Shipping . You can find this option on the "Apple ID" menu. It will open your payment settings for all purchases and downloads. [4] X Research source If you're prompted, enter your Apple ID password, and tap OK to proceed.

steps.title: Tap the Add Payment Method button.
steps.content: Tap the Add Payment Method button. This option is at the top of the "Manage Payments" or "Payment & Shipping" page. It will open your payment options.

steps.title: Select Credit/Debit Card under "PAYMENT METHOD.
steps.content: Select Credit/Debit Card under "PAYMENT METHOD. " This option will allow you to add any credit or debit card as your payment method for app purchases and subscriptions. Alternatively, you can select the PayPal option here, and tap the Log In to PayPal button. This will link your PayPal to your Apple ID, and use your PayPal to pay for iTunes and app purchases. Once you add a valid payment method here, you can use it to pay for your Apple Music subscription.

steps.title: Enter your card details into the payment form.
steps.content: Enter your card details into the payment form. You will have to enter your card number, expiration date, and CVV security code. You can tap the blue camera icon next to Number to take a picture of your card, and automatically fill out the card number here.

steps.title: Enter your billing information.
steps.content: Enter your billing information. You will have to enter your legal name, and full billing address in order to validate your payment method.

steps.title: Tap the Done button on the top-right.
steps.content: Tap the Done button on the top-right. This will add and save your new payment method to your Apple ID. You can now start an Apple Music subscription, and pay for your selected plan. This will take you back to the "Manage Payments" page. If you're not sure how to start an Apple Music subscription on your iPhone or iPad, check out this article for detailed instructions.

steps.title: Tap the Edit button on the top-right (optional).
steps.content: Tap the Edit button on the top-right (optional). If you have multiple payment methods saved, you can reorder your payment methods here to set your primary method for your subscriptions.

steps.title: Press and hold the three-lined ☰ icon next to a method.
steps.content: Press and hold the three-lined ☰ icon next to a method. This will allow you to move the selected payment method to the top on the list, and make it your primary method for your Apple Music subscription.

steps.title: Move the selected payment method to the top of the list.
steps.content: Move the selected payment method to the top of the list. This will make the selected card your primary method of payment. Your subscription will be automatically paid with this primary method.

steps.title: Open the Apple Music app on your Android.
steps.content: Open the Apple Music app on your Android. The Apple Music icon looks like a purple-and-blue musical note icon in a white circle. You can find it on your home screen or on the Apps tray. [5] X Research source Editing your payment information on Android will remove all payment methods except your primary method from your Apple ID, including all your other devices that you use with your Apple ID. [6] X Research source If you don't have any payment methods saved to your Apple ID, you will not be able to add one for the first time on Android. Make sure to use iTunes on a computer or an iPhone/iPad if you're adding your first payment method. If you're just joining Apple Music for the first time now, make sure to check out this article to see how to do it on Android. You can use an existing Apple ID, or create a new Apple ID and enter your payment information during registration. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Library, For You, Browse or Radio at the bottom.
steps.content: Tap Library , For You , Browse or Radio at the bottom. If the Apple Music app opens up to a song or a different page, tap one of the tabs on the bottom toolbar. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the red ⋮ three-dot icon on the top-right.
steps.content: Tap the red ⋮ three-dot icon on the top-right. This button is in the upper-right corner of your screen. It will open a drop-down menu.

steps.title: Tap Account on the drop-down menu.
steps.content: Tap Account on the drop-down menu. This will open your account options on a new page. If you don't see this option, tap Settings , and tap Sign In at the top to sign in with your Apple ID.

steps.title: Tap Payment Information on the Account menu.
steps.content: Tap Payment Information on the Account menu. This option will allow you to change or remove your current payment information.

steps.title: Select Credit/Debit Card under "PAYMENT METHOD.
steps.content: Select Credit/Debit Card under "PAYMENT METHOD. " This will allow you to enter your card details, and add a new payment method to pay for Apple Music. This option will let you change your current Apple Music payment method with a different card. Changing your payment information on Android will automatically remove all other saved payment methods from your Apple ID, except for your primary method. [9] X Research source If you just want to remove your Apple Music payment method, select None here.

steps.title: Enter your card and billing information.
steps.content: Enter your card and billing information. You will have to fill out your complete card information, and the corresponding billing address on file with your financial institution. You will need to enter your card number, expiration date, CVV security code, full legal name, and full address here.

steps.title: Tap the Done button.
steps.content: Tap the Done button. This will save your new payment method. Your Apple Music payments will now be charged to this payment method.
